1 Preparing your structure-organism pairs library

Adriano Rutz

2022-02-09

Source: vignettes/1-library.Rmd
1-library.Rmd

This vignette describes how to get and prepare a structure-organism pairs library in order to

  • Annotate or complement the annotation of your feature. (optional)
  • Weight your initial annotations.

LOTUS

As we developed LOTUS1 with Taxonomically Informed Metabolite Annotation in mind, we provide it here as a starting point for your structure-organism pairs library. You are free to complement it with your own structure-organism pairs or to filter it according to your needs. We also provide some hints on how to do it later in this vignette.

download

To download it LOTUS structure-organism pairs locally, just run:

library("timaR")
source(file = "inst/scripts/get_lotus.R")
#> This script downloads LOTUS referenced structure-organism pairs. 
#> 2022-02-09 15:44:06 Authors:  AR 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:44:06 Contributors: ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:44:06 Loading paths
#> Rows: 1080820 Columns: 35
#> â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (31): structure_wikidata, structure_inchikey, structure_inchi, structure...
#> dbl  (4): structure_exact_mass, structure_stereocenters_total, structure_ste...
#> 
#> â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 Script finished in 1.457074 mins

preparation

Then, LOTUS structure-organism pairs can be prepared to the right format for further processing:

source(file = "inst/scripts/prepare_lotus.R")
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 This script prepares LOTUS referenced structure-organism pairs 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 Authors:  AR 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 Contributors: ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 Loading paths 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:33 Loading files
#> Rows: 1080820 Columns: 35
#> â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (31): structure_wikidata, structure_inchikey, structure_inchi, structure...
#> dbl  (4): structure_exact_mass, structure_stereocenters_total, structure_ste...
#> 
#> â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:52 Exporting ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Script finished in 23.7993 secs

For these two first steps, you do not need to change any parameters as they are implemented by default.

Other libraries

As we want our tool to be flexible, you can also add your own library to LOTUS. You just need to format it in order to be compatible. As example, we prepared some ways too format closed, in house libraries. If you need help formatting your library or would like to share it with us for it to be implemented, feel free to contact us.

Before running the corresponding code, do not forget to modify config/params/prepare_closed.yaml

source(file = "inst/scripts/prepare_closed.R")
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 This script prepares closed referenced structure-organism pairs 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Authors:  AR 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Contributors: ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading paths 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading yaml parameters 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading command line arguments 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Sorry, you do not have access to the closed resource 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Script finished in 0.2232211 secs

Merging

Once you have all your sub-libraries prepared, you are ready to merge them in a single file that will be used for the next steps.

Before running the corresponding code, do not forget to modify config/params/prepare_library.yaml.

At this step, if you want to, you can restrict your library to specific taxa only. We do not advise doing so, but we offer you the possibility to do it.

source(file = "inst/scripts/prepare_library.R")
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 This script prepares a library from prepared sub-libraries. 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Authors:  AR 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Contributors: ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading paths 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading yaml parameters 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading command line arguments 
#> 2022-02-09 15:45:57 Loading and concatenating prepared libraries
#> Rows: 718673 Columns: 19
#> â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr (18): structure_inchikey_2D, structure_smiles_2D, structure_molecular_fo...
#> dbl  (1): structure_exact_mass
#> 
#> â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:01 Exporting ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:01 ... path to export is inst/extdata/interim/libraries/library.tsv.gz 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 ... path to used parameters is inst/extdata/interim/config 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Script finished in 8.072288 secs

Adducts library

As a main limitation of current annotation tools is adducts detection and coverage, an adducts library can also be generated in order to perform MS1 annotation later on.

Before running the corresponding code, do not forget to modify config/params/prepare_adducts.yaml.

source(file = "inst/scripts/prepare_adducts.R")
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 This script prepares adducts 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Authors:  AR 
#>  
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Contributors: ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Loading paths 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Loading yaml parameters 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Loading command line arguments 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 Loading files ... 
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:05 ... exact masses
#> Rows: 718673 Columns: 1
#> â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> dbl (1): structure_exact_mass
#> 
#> â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:06 ... adducts
#> Rows: 18 Columns: 2
#> â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr (1): adduct
#> dbl (1): mass
#> 
#> â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:06 Treating adducts table
#> Warning in data.frame(..., check.names = FALSE): row names were found from a
#> short variable and have been discarded
#> 2022-02-09 15:46:06 Adding adducts to exact masses ...

#> 2022-02-09 15:46:07 ... negative

We now recommend you to read the next vignette.
